Hare Krishna, Hare Krishna, Krishna Krishna, Hare Hare, Hare Rama, Hare Rama, Rama Rama, Hare Hare, Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya, Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchevanarottamam, Devim Sarasvatim Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet.
In this session we will be discussing from the 29th verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Continuing the prayers by Queen Kunti.
The meaning of this verse is,
No one can understand your transcendental pastimes which appear to be human and are so misleading.
You have no specific object of love nor do you have any object of envy.
People only imagine that you are partial.
This is a prayer.
So Kunti is helping us understand what is the nature of Krishna's personality.
Krishna is completely transcendental which means that he has no enmity.
He has no special liking for somebody.
He is not partial.
It appears sometimes like he is partial to his devotees.
It appears like that.
So that will be explained here in the purport by Srila Prabhupada.
The Lord's mercy upon the fallen souls is equally distributed.
He has no one as the specific object of hostility.
Now this point is very important.
The very conception of the personality of Godhead as a human being is misleading.
Krishna is not a human being.
Krishna is the Supreme Unlimited Lord.
Full of all good qualities.
He is absolute.
He is all good.
Every living being is his part and parcel and therefore every living being is dear to him.
As the part and parcel living being.
His pastimes in this material world especially
appear to be exactly like a human being's activities.
But actually they are transcendental.
They are without any tinge of material contamination.
Because Krishna does not come in contact with material nature.
The material modes are not able to influence Krishna.
The material modes always are influenced by Krishna.
Only the conditioned souls.
Why?
Because the conditioned souls want to enjoy materially.
Therefore the material modes will act on them.
Only then they can try to enjoy.
Though there is no enjoyment.
Now here one point Srila Prabhupada explains.
That Krishna is known to be partial to his pure devotees.
But actually he is not partial.
He appears to be partial to his pure devotees.
Just like Prabhupada gives the example of the sun.
The sun is never partial to anybody.
By utilizing the sun rays.
Sometimes even the stones become valuable.
Brilliant jewels.
Whereas a blind man cannot see the sun.
Although there are enough sun rays before him.
So darkness and light are two opposite conceptions.
But this does not mean that the sun is partial in distributing its rays.
In spite of the sun being present in the sky.
Why is there darkness in some places?
Because even though the sun rays are open to everyone.
The capacity of the receptacles are different.
Foolish people think that devotional service is something like.
Flattering Krishna to get some special mercy.
Whereas the fact is.
That the Lord has so many unlimited number of pure devotees.
And those pure devotees are always engaged.
In the transcendental loving service of the Supreme Lord Krishna.
Always.
And they are not like a mercantile community.
Now mercantile community.
People are merchants.
They render some service in exchange for value.
They always want something in exchange.
That's the nature of a commercial transaction.
So a pure devotee.
Even though he is always engaged in serving Krishna lovingly.
He never does any service with expectation of something in return from Krishna.
Never.
Never.
Never.

Krishna's full mercy is open for him.
